instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight works for a split second.
threads.message:
Liquid damage.
Backlight work but only for split second.
Backlight output is 39V then slowly dropping to 0V.

On image voltage in blue is stable, in green is slowly dropping.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight works for a split second.
threads.message: Do you have a picture the entire time?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight works for a split second.
threads.message: Usually on issue with <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>. Check IOboard and flex cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight works for a split second.
threads.message:
arghhh - image was all the time on display
dukefawks - it was faulty IO board - thank you
